qas.question: Along with arsenic, what metal is roughly as abundant as uranium?
Along with silver, mercury, tin and cadmium, what metal is uranium more plentiful than?
What is the most prevalent uranium ore?
What types of rocks sometimes contain uranium?
Along with arsenic, what metal is less abundant as uranium?
Along with silver, mercury, tin and cadmium, what metal is uranium less plentiful than?
What is the least prevalent uranium ore?
What types of rocks never contain uranium?

context: Uranium is more plentiful than <a1_0><b6_0>antimony<b6_0/><a1_0/>, tin, cadmium, mercury, or silver, and it is about as abundant as arsenic or <a0_0><b5_0>molybdenum<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Uranium is found in hundreds of minerals, including <a2_0><b7_0>uraninite<b7_0/><a2_0/> (the most common uranium ore), carnotite, autunite, uranophane, torbernite, and coffinite. Significant concentrations of uranium occur in some substances such as <a4_0><b9_0>phosphate<b9_0/><a4_0/> rock deposits, and minerals such as <a3_0><b8_0>lignite<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and monazite sands in uranium-rich ores (it is recovered commercially from sources with as little as 0.1% uranium).
